messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Sandra--unschooling.com
messages.msgSnippet: The deschooling article was great........very enlightening.  Actually there are tons of great articles there........of course I couldn t get 1/2 of them to
messages.messageBody:
The deschooling article was great........very enlightening.  Actually there are tons of great articles there........of course I couldn't get 1/2 of them to open up which was disappointing but what is there is very helpful.  I know I'll be spending more hours there filling my brain with reinforcements.
Rachel

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Sandra--unschooling.com
messages.msgSnippet: Unschooling.com s Message Boards: Getting started unschooling: Help! TV Binging! ... Unschooling.com s Message Boards: Getting started unschooling: Considering
messages.messageBody:
Unschooling.com's Message Boards: Getting started unschooling: Help! TV
Binging!
------------------------------------------------------------------------


Unschooling.com's Message Boards: Getting started unschooling: Considering
unschooling but have a few concerns


I found the link in TV Binging, and the original was in the same area
(Getting started) under Considering unschooling, a post from Anne
By Anne Ohman (Anneo) on Monday, February 12, 2001 - 10:07 am:

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Sandra--unschooling.com
messages.msgSnippet: Something wonderful was just posted at unschooling.com yesterday, about deschooling ourselves. This list is only the tip of an iceberg of information and
messages.messageBody:
Something wonderful was just posted at unschooling.com yesterday, about
deschooling ourselves.

This list is only the tip of an iceberg of information and support at
www.unschooling.com and you should definitely check all of that out!

Sandra,

I give up. I looked in every message board there and couldn't find the deschooling message. Where is the post? Could you post the link here? Thanks.


--
Sandi in VA
"Home is where the HEART is!"

"What is most important and valuable about the home as a base for
children's growth into the world is not that it is a better school than
the schools,but that it isn't a school at all."
John Holt
